entry.title: Coding9_Palindrome Number
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Determine whether an integer is a palindrome. Do this without extra space.

Some hints:
Could negative integers be palindromes? (ie, -1)

If you are thinking of converting the integer to string, note the restriction of using extra space.

You could also try reversing an integer. However, if you have solved the problem “Reverse Integer”, you know that the reversed integer might overflow. How would you handle such case?

There is a more generic way of solving this problem.

My Algorithm

idea:

第一个跟最后一个比较，然后i++,j–

code:

public class Solution {
    public static boolean isPalindrome(int x) {
        boolean flag = true;
        if (x < 0) {
            flag = false;
        }
        String string = String.valueOf(x);
        // int i=0;
        int j = string.length() - 1;
        for (int i = 0; i < string.length() / 2; i++, j--) {
            if (string.charAt(i) != string.charAt(j)) {
                flag = false;
            }
        }
        return flag;
    }
}
entry.summary: Algorithm Description

entry.title: Coding8_String to Integer (atoi)
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Description:
Implement atoi to convert a string to an integer.

Hint: Carefully consider all possible input cases. If you want a challenge, please do not see below and ask yourself what are the possible input cases.

Notes: It is intended for this problem to be specified vaguely (ie, no given input specs). You are responsible to gather all the input requirements up front.

Requirements for atoi:

The function first discards as many whitespace characters as necessary until the first non-whitespace character is found. Then, starting from this character, takes an optional initial plus or minus sign followed by as many numerical digits as possible, and interprets them as a numerical value.

The string can contain additional characters after those that form the integral number, which are ignored and have no effect on the behavior of this function.

If the first sequence of non-whitespace characters in str is not a valid integral number, or if no such sequence exists because either str is empty or it contains only whitespace characters, no conversion is performed.

If no valid conversion could be performed, a zero value is returned. If the correct value is out of the range of representable values, INT_MAX (2147483647) or INT_MIN (-2147483648) is returned.

My Algorithm

idea:

把字符串转换成一个整数

“+0012HY” return +12
“__ + __ 1A” return +1
“__ - __ 1A” return -1
“ABC+0125” return 0（错误返回0）
就是从前往后查找遇到的第一个数字
引用了别人的想法！！！

  1. convert String to char array
  2. judge the first character
  3. convert one after another
  4. judge if overflow

code:

public class Solution {
    public static int myAtoi(String str) {
            str = str.trim();
            char[] ch = str.toCharArray();
            if (ch.length == 0) {
                return 0;
            }
            int i = 0;
            boolean isM = false;
            if (ch[0] == '+') {
                i++;
            } else if (ch[0] == '-') {
                isM = true;
                i++;
            } else if (!(ch[0] >= '0' && ch[0] <= '9')) {
                return 0;
            }
            long result = 0;
            while (i < ch.length && ch[i] >= '0' && ch[i] <= '9') {
                result = result * 10 + ch[i++] - '0';
                if (result >= Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
                    if (isM) {
                        if (result > Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
                            return Integer.MIN_VALUE;
                        }
                    } else {
                        return Integer.MAX_VALUE;
                    }
                }
            }
            return isM ? (int) (0 - result) : (int) result;
    }
}
entry.summary: Algorithm Description

entry.title: Coding1_Two Sum
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Given an array of integers, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to a specific target.

You may assume that each input would have exactly one solution.
Example:

Given nums = [2, 7, 11, 15], target = 9,

Because nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9,
return [0, 1].

My Algorithm

idea:

两数相加得一个特定数，返回两数的索引

code:

public class Solution {
    public int[] twoSum(int[] nums, int target) {
          for (int i = 0; i < nums.length; i++) {
            for (int j = i + 1; j < nums.length; j++) {
                if ((nums[i] + nums[j]) == target) {
                    return new int[] { i, j };
                }
            }
        }
    return null;
    }
}

entry.title: Coding7_Reverse Integer
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Description:
Reverse digits of an integer.
Example1: x = 123, return 321
Example2: x = -123, return -321

Have you thought about this?

Here are some good questions to ask before coding. Bonus points for you if you have already thought through this!

If the integer’s last digit is 0, what should the output be? ie, cases such as 10, 100.

Did you notice that the reversed integer might overflow? Assume the input is a 32-bit integer, then the reverse of 1000000003 overflows. How should you handle such cases?

For the purpose of this problem, assume that your function returns 0 when the reversed integer overflows.

My Algorithm

idea:

NOTE:
1、关于正负号的判断
2、末尾数数字为0的数字、输入100 返回1
3、int -2147483648～2147483647 翻转后字符串溢出的问题、溢出返回0
4、StringBuffer类中有对字符串反转的处理 reverse()

code:

  public class Solution {
    public static int reverse(int x) {
        boolean flag = true;
        String a = null;
        int b = 0;
        String string = String.valueOf(x);
        if (x > 0) {
            StringBuffer sBuffer = new StringBuffer(string);
            a = sBuffer.reverse().toString();
        } else if (x < 0) {
            flag = false;
            String string2 = string.substring(1);
            StringBuffer sBuffer = new StringBuffer(string2);
            a = sBuffer.reverse().toString();
        }
        try {
            b = Integer.parseInt(a);
        } catch (Exception e) {
            if (b > 2147483647 || b < -2147483648) {
                return 0;
            }
        }
        if (flag) {
            return b;
        } else {
            return -b;
        }
    }
}

entry.title: Coding27_Remove Element
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Given an array and a value, remove all instances of that value in place and return the new length.

Do not allocate extra space for another array, you must do this in place with constant memory.

The order of elements can be changed. It doesn’t matter what you leave beyond the new length.

Example:
Given input array nums = [3,2,2,3], val = 3

Your function should return length = 2, with the first two elements of nums being 2.

Hint:

  1. Try two pointers.
  2. Did you use the property of “the order of elements can be changed”?
  3. What happens when the elements to remove are rare?

entry.title: Coding13_ Roman to Integer
entry.content:
Algorithm Description

Given a roman numeral, convert it to an integer.

Input is guaranteed to be within the range from 1 to 3999.

My Algorithm

idea:

罗马数字共有七个，即I(1)，V(5)，X(10)，L(50)，C(100)，D(500)，M(1000)。按照下面的规则可以表示任意正整数。

重复数次：一个罗马数字重复几次，就表示这个数的几倍。
右加左减：在一个较大的罗马数字的右边记上一个较小的罗马数字，表示大数字加小数字。在一个较大的数字的左边记上一个较小的罗马数字，表示大数字减小数字。但是，左减不能跨越等级。比如，99不可以用IC表示，用XCIX表示。
加线乘千：在一个罗马数字的上方加上一条横线或者在右下方写M，表示将这个数字乘以1000，即是原数的1000倍。同理，如果上方有两条横线，即是原数的1000000倍。
单位限制：同样单位只能出现3次，如40不能表示为XXXX，而要表示为XL。

MCXIV—-1114
CCCLIX—359

code:

  public class Solution {
       public static int romanToInt(String s) {
        if (null == s || s.trim().length() == 0)
            return 0;
        s = s.trim();// 去除空格
        char[] cstr = s.toCharArray();
        int sum = 0;
        for (int i = 0; i < cstr.length-1; i++) {
            int cur = romanToValue(cstr[i]);
            int next = romanToValue(cstr[i + 1]);
            if (cur >= next) {
                sum += cur;
            } else {
                sum -= cur;
            }
        }
        sum += romanToValue(cstr[cstr.length - 1]);
        return sum;

    }
    //罗马数字与整数的对应
    private static int romanToValue(char c) {
        switch (c) {
        case 'I':
            return 1;
        case 'V':
            return 5;
        case 'X':
            return 10;
        case 'L':
            return 50;
        case 'C':
            return 100;
        case 'D':
            return 500;
        case 'M':
            return 1000;
        default:
            return 0;
        }
    }
}
